TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit VisualStyleElement/ProgressBar/ChunkVertical extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides a for the pieces that fill a vertical progress bar. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ProgressBar.ChunkVertical.Normal%2A> property of the VisualStyleElement.ProgressBar.ChunkVertical class returns a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> that represents the pieces that fill a vertical progress bar.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ProgressBar.ChunkVertical.Normal%2A> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementProgressBarChunkVertical1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#204](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/0e57f0cd-cbfc-4830-9249-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#204](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/0e57f0cd-cbfc-4830-9249-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the pieces that fill a vertical progress bar.
Docs.value: A that represents the pieces that fill a vertical progress bar.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Normal property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Normal property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementProgressBarChunkVertical1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#204](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/ab711b94-dcb2-41b8-820a-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#204](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/ab711b94-dcb2-41b8-820a-_1.vb)]
